text: In this study , we demonstrate the effects of DZA on nuclear factor-kappaB ( NF-kappaB ) regulation .

DZA inhibits the transcriptional activity of NF-kappaB through the hindrance of <extra_id_0> p65 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> Rel-A <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) phosphorylation without reduction of its nuclear translocation and DNA binding activity .

text: The inhibitory effect of DZA on NF-kappaB transcriptional activity is potentiated by the addition of homocysteine .

text: This study strongly suggests that DZA may be a potent drug for the treatment of diseases in which NF-kappaB plays a central pathogenic role , as well as a useful tool for studying the regulation and physiological functions of NF-kappaB .
